titleStmt.title: An elegie upon the never satisfactorily deplored death of that rare column of Parnassus, Mr. Iohn Cleeveland.
titleStmt.author: Pecke, Thomas, b. 1637.

publicationStmt.publisher: Printed by W. Godbid, for Henry Marsh at the Princes Arms at the lower end of Chancery Lane, near the Inner Temple gate in Fleetstreet,

notesStmt.note: Verse: "Is Cleeveland dead and not one weeping pen".
Reproduction of original in the British Library.
